meanings.definition: To speak in a slow, lazy manner.
meanings.sent1: She drawls her words when she's tired.
meanings.sent2: He drawls out his sentences when he's bored.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy cat drawls a meow as it stretches.
meanings.sent4: The old record player drawls out the music in a nostalgic way.
meanings.sent5: The drawling voice of the storyteller made the tale seem never-ending.

meanings.definition: Loose-fitting undergarments worn by men or women.
meanings.sent1: He wore comfortable drawls under his jeans.
meanings.sent2: She bought a new pair of drawls for lounging at home.
meanings.sent3: The drawls peeked out from his pants as he bent over.
meanings.sent4: Her favorite drawls felt like a cozy hug.
meanings.sent5: The soft fabric of the drawls kept her warm on chilly nights.
